p: RTILs exhibit a broad range of conductivities spanning from 0.1 to 20 mS cm âˆ’1 [ 17]. In general, higher conductivities are found for imidazolium based ILs in comparison with the ammonium ones. Many factors can affect their conductivity, such as viscosity, density, ion size, anionic charge delocalization, aggregations and ionic motions [ 18]. Strong ion-pair associations have been invoked in the case of bis(trifluoromethylsulfonyl)imide ([NTf 2] -, Tf = triflate) based ILs, to understand their lower conductivity in comparison with tetrafluoroborate based ionic liquids [ 18].
